attachments.fallback: [July 3rd, 2016 10:29 AM] sander: Hey guys, a few days ago I got in contact with an investment fund, it’s called Innovationquarter (<http://www.innovationquarter.nl/>). In order for them to evaluate funding opportunities they are asking for a business plan. I’ve started to write one but I need some input from you.. An important part of a business plan is the team, therefore I need all of you to write a short story about yourself before Wednesday. It should reflect your strengths, capabilities, experience, etc. Also, feel free to add or edit things in the document! I want to send it to them on Wednesday so please make sure to do this before then. Here’s the link: <https://docs.google.com/a/codingthehumanities.com/document/d/1wYPfqWV4g4l4pj4mr2YafbskzqQRnGlv9sAZ6jZ63y8/edit?usp=sharing>

Just following up to make sure you received your invitation to Web Summit on Monday?  It contains all the information about the startup programme and the discounted registration details.

If you did not receive your original invitation or if you have any additional questions, let me know. 

Regards,
Paddy

text: I'm open to more effective / better ways of organizing this, but realize that not having a central call puts the extra burden of communicating, catching up, and coordinating with everyone of you on me. This is not a very effective use of my time. Please be mindful of that. My time is better spend working on the platform and the business.

In general, I understand that the weekly call is a big investment for all of us, but -given the fact that we are a remote / part-time team- it's one of the few instances that we actually get to communicate and coordinate with each other.
<!channel>: okay, let's cancel the call then, since <@U19SW5FAR> and <@U0ARRNM3R> have both also already canceled.

sorry for being not that enthousiastic...

I have some programmer-friends who went two years ago the Web Summit in Dublin. The also we’re “selected”, they had a great time together in Dublin, but they didn’t get anything out of it. It seems you got a lot for free, but you also have to invest a lot of money. And from my own experiences I’ve been as an exhibitor at several trade shows…  it’s a lot of talking, people seems to be interested, but when you call them afterwards they “hang up the phone”.
That's great news! Good job <@U177W7XH8> <@U19SW5FAR>!
<!channel> So we have to decide before Friday if we still want to do this (considering the price)

We got selected for the Web Summit in Lisbon! :tada:

Hi Sander,

Just reaching out to thank you for catching up with the team recently. I'm delighted to say that your startup has been selected to participate on the ALPHA startup track at Web Summit 2016.

Web Summit will run for three days from November 8-10 in Lisbon, Portugal. It is the meeting place for the most interesting tech companies across all sectors, stages and geographies. It’s the “Davos for Geeks”.

Over a three-day programme of networking, learning and storytelling, the world’s most cutting-edge startups, the most experienced investors and the most exciting speakers will mingle and connect in Lisbon.

From a startup perspective, we want early stage companies to have as productive and stress-free a time as possible. You can register for ALPHA using this code: WSANV5171 and following this link. You must input this code to avail of the discounted package. The deadline to register is this coming Friday.


The package contains:
Four tickets to Web Summit which include access to all three days (500+ speakers across 15 different stages, 100+ Partners, 500+ investors, 500+ startups) and the Night Summit (3 nights of socialising, networking and building relationships across Lisbon’s most fantastic locations).
Exhibition space for one of the three days in your chosen industry area.
Opportunity to access workshops, roundtables & office hours with potential investors and mentors.
Fulfilment officer to help with preparations and gather all your information six weeks out from the event.
Access to Web Summit mobile application to help you build connections prior to the event & curate your own schedule (Released 1 week before event). You will have both an attendee profile for each of your team members, as well as a company feature on the application.
The event takes place November 8-10, with pre-registration and festivities kicking off on November 7. Please arrange travel & accommodation accordingly.
You can read more about our new home, Lisbon, here & here.
You can read more about startup experiences at Web Summit 2015 here, here, here & here.

We're excited to put on an awesome show in Lisbon, and look forward to sharing some amazing updates in the coming weeks and months.

Any more questions, let me know.

Obrigado,

Paddy
Startups Manager 
Twitter: @ThePadman
Looks horrible but efffective haha

text: Cool! I've always wanted to live in Norway :grin:
<https://techcrunch.com/2016/06/20/norwegian-startup-scene/?utm_content=buffer85c1a&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer>

attachments.title: Keep an eye on Norway: Its startup scene is about to go huge
attachments.text: When I headed back to Norway to take a deep dive into its startup scene, I have to admit my expectations weren't that high. Completely unfounded: In just a few short years, it has gone from been a pretty bleak affair to being a real -- if nascent -- startup ecosystem. It's full of ambition, ideas, and - yes - some really exciting startups.
attachments.fallback: TechCrunch Link: Keep an eye on Norway: Its startup scene is about to go huge

attachments.title: Web Summit | ALPHA
attachments.text: It's been called 'the best technology conference on the planet'. But we just think it's different.
